newsitem.title: GERMANY: Kirch, Springer taking control of SAT1.
newsitem.headline: Kirch, Springer taking control of SAT1.

text.p: German media groups Kirch Group and Axel Springer Verlag AG said on Monday they were buying out small shareholders to raise their respective holdings in the SAT1 television channel.

A spokesman for Bavarian media mogul Leo Kirch confirmed a magazine report that said he would take advantage of new media ownership rules that took effect this year to raise his stake in SAT1 to more than 50 percent.

Separately, Springer Verlag, which publishes the mass daily Bild newspaper, said it has paid some 80 million marks to raise its stake in SAT1 shareholder Aktuell Presse Fernsehen (APF) to 90 percent from 41.02 percent.
Because APF and Springer each hold 20 percent of SAT1, the deal indirectly raises Springer's SAT1 holdings to around 40 percent.
A revision of German media law that took effect on January 1 now makes it possible for the first time for an investor to own more than 50 percent of a television broadcaster

Kirch, the main SAT1 shareholder with a stake of 43 percent, confirmed that it was in talks to buy another 16 percent of the broadcaster from a group of small shareholders but said the deal had not been completed.
Kirch is seeking to buy SAT1 shares from Ravensburger Film + TV GmbH and AV Euromedia, a subsidiary of the Holtzbrinck Group, publisher of the German economic daily Handeslblatt.
Springer, surprised by Kirch's moves to raise its SAT1 stake, said it held rights of first purchase to around 6.4 percent of the additional shares sought by Kirch.
In the end, Kirch could end up owning 52.6 percent of SAT1 and Springer 46.4 percent.
